revised_title: Triply Periodic Minimal Surfaces in Chemistry and Materials Science
tldr: This article explores the use of differential geometry and minimal surfaces in understanding various structures in chemistry and materials science. It focuses on triply periodic minimal surfaces (TPMS) and their significance in biological materials and other non-crystalline structures. The authors discuss various methods for generating and analyzing TPMS, including Weierstrass parametrization, analytical derivation, and finite element methods like the Surface Evolver.
